channel.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
channel.description: Hello, In the past 2 years runescape have been coding varies different updates to make runescape a better place, whats your views on if they've done it for the best, was taking pking out of runescape a good idea?

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“A Legend, post:14, topic:266832”][quote]I’m assuming it did change some things, as a lot of management shifts have been happening for the last year.

I didn’t make that post to argue about Jagex staffing. I made it to prove a point. People make the past sound better than it was just so that they have something to complain about. Face it people, RS is barely worse than it was a few years ago. In fact, there were more rulebreakers back then and more reasons to break the rules.[/quote]

Back then there was more Freedom then there is now, everything now is based on rules (In-Game)[/quote]

Everything has always been based on rules. They even had a spot in runescape to hold rule-breakers.

Read full topic
item.source: Have runescape updates been for the best?

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @A_Legend A Legend
item.description:
@A_Legend wrote:

I'm assuming it did change some things, as a lot of management shifts have been happening for the last year.

I didn’t make that post to argue about Jagex staffing. I made it to prove a point. People make the past sound better than it was just so that they have something to complain about. Face it people, RS is barely worse than it was a few years ago. In fact, there were more rulebreakers back then and more reasons to break the rules.

Back then there was more Freedom then there is now, everything now is based on rules (In-Game)

Read full topic
item.source: Have runescape updates been for the best?

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=352336.msg2703869#msg2703869 date=1236826388]

What did stopping RWT even for for Jagex? Allow them to earn just a little bit more than they already did? Who cares? Taking out largely used aspects of the game because they want more money was a stupid choice. Sure, it made the game more “fair”; but considering a large portion of players were PKers, it also made it less enjoyable. Those who claim PKing still exists, it’s not the same. If you played back then and were a real “PKer” you’d understand.

I still don’t understand to this day how/why Jagex did what they did with RWT, and especially how many ate it up and became sheep. I miss the olden days as in RSC where the staff actually played and interacted with players. People were more mature, trustworthy, and the game was a challenge.

What a joke. You know the game has barely improved player wise. Though the players may seem more mature, that’s only because a lot of the pking crowd was made up of older people. But really, most of the same players that played then still play today.

And why did they do it? Because they realized that, on the economic standpoint, something needed to happen. I personally believe they are also a bit understaffed, so they weren’t able to keep chasing RWT around. Why are the understaffed? That’s quite obvious, as they are releasing a new MMO soon, and that requires a ton of staff, right? So anyway, I think they did what they did to save the game from anymore hell on a very complicated, factor-filled basis.
[/quote]
the CEO said in a question thread on rs that they hired a whole new team for the new MMO – didn’t affect RS development etc at all.[/quote]

I’m assuming it did change some things, as a lot of management shifts have been happening for the last year.

I didn’t make that post to argue about Jagex staffing. I made it to prove a point. People make the past sound better than it was just so that they have something to complain about. Face it people, RS is barely worse than it was a few years ago. In fact, there were more rulebreakers back then and more reasons to break the rules.

Read full topic
item.source: Have runescape updates been for the best?

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @A_Legend A Legend
item.description:
@A_Legend wrote:

What did stopping RWT even for for Jagex? Allow them to earn just a little bit more than they already did? Who cares? Taking out largely used aspects of the game because they want more money was a stupid choice. Sure, it made the game more "fair"; but considering a large portion of players were PKers, it also made it less enjoyable. Those who claim PKing still exists, it's not the same. If you played back then and were a real "PKer" you'd understand.

I agree with you, the days when people used to train hard to achieve skills to pk in places such as mage bank, people used to actually play the game with spirit, now there isn’t really anything to it, i liked it when there wasn’t weapons what can hit as much as they do now, i liked it when whip was ruling the weaponry.

Read full topic
item.source: Have runescape updates been for the best?

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Niall:

The game has been terrible since 2007, it all started when they were adding in a new quest every week or so. (Late 2006/early 2007 I think.)

Correction:
The game has been terrible since the release of RS2.

Read full topic

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Imo the updates are shit. It seems every time they make an okay update, they have to ruin it with something else.

E.G.

Soul Wars- Priority Level

PvP Worlds - Dragon Claws (All they do is PJ…)

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

`Rich:

According to Jagex, they would’ve had to shut down the game if they didn’t remove the old-style wilderness.

They realeased RS Classic so why cant they simply make another classic version that has the proper wildy, training, trade system and pest control

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

TeleNubby:

What did stopping RWT even for for Jagex? Allow them to earn just a little bit more than they already did? Who cares? Taking out largely used aspects of the game because they want more money was a stupid choice. Sure, it made the game more “fair”; but considering a large portion of players were PKers, it also made it less enjoyable. Those who claim PKing still exists, it’s not the same. If you played back then and were a real “PKer” you’d understand.

According to Jagex, they would’ve had to shut down the game if they didn’t remove the old-style wilderness.

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:6, topic:266832”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=352336.msg2703812#msg2703812 date=1236821651]
What did stopping RWT even for for Jagex? Allow them to earn just a little bit more than they already did? Who cares? Taking out largely used aspects of the game because they want more money was a stupid choice. Sure, it made the game more “fair”; but considering a large portion of players were PKers, it also made it less enjoyable. Those who claim PKing still exists, it’s not the same. If you played back then and were a real “PKer” you’d understand.
[/quote]

I still don’t understand to this day how/why Jagex did what they did with RWT, and especially how many ate it up and became sheep. I miss the olden days as in RSC where the staff actually played and interacted with players. People were more mature, trustworthy, and the game was a challenge.[/quote]

What a joke. You know the game has barely improved player wise. Though the players may seem more mature, that’s only because a lot of the pking crowd was made up of older people. But really, most of the same players that played then still play today.

And why did they do it? Because they realized that, on the economic standpoint, something needed to happen. I personally believe they are also a bit understaffed, so they weren’t able to keep chasing RWT around. Why are the understaffed? That’s quite obvious, as they are releasing a new MMO soon, and that requires a ton of staff, right? So anyway, I think they did what they did to save the game from anymore hell on a very complicated, factor-filled basis.

Read full topic

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

I remember the early days of RuneScape where I would Duel for money, Pk with friends in the deep wildy, and merchant items for hours. It was when they started breaking down on RWT that the game instantly went to shit, taking out pking and dueling took out the 2 best things to do in the game I thick, and giving items a set price ruined merchanting. The game has been on a downward slope, and from the looks of it they aren’t planning on changes because they care so much about preventing RWT that they are ruining the game to stop it.

Read full topic
item.source: Have runescape updates been for the best?

item.title: Have runescape updates been for the best?
item.dc:creator: @A_Legend A Legend
item.description:
@A_Legend wrote:

Back to wildy without a stupid barrier I say. I liked pking back then. Now the pk worlds suck. I hate the way you can't trade properly. The game has gotten gay, or maybe I'm just too old.

I agree, the times when pking was allot easier without all the rules they’ve placed down now it would be allot better, also i liked having to be able to try and get into world 2 and walk around trying to buy items i think that was the whole point of the game to get your own way through it, when they brought out you just have to put your money into a machine and get the item you want straight away that just defeats the object of it all.

Read full topic
